intro: Choripetalum, commonly known as the "false hellebore," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melanthiaceae. It is characterized by its showy, often white or pink flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and is native to regions of Europe and Asia.
